com.thalesgroup.gemalto.d1.d1pay

Class ContactlessTransactionListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thalesgroup.gemalto.d1.d1pay.ContactlessTransactionListener

  • public abstract class ContactlessTransactionListener
extends Object
    Provide callback and utility helper for a contactless transaction
    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContactlessTransactionListener

        public ContactlessTransactionListener()

    • Method Detail

      • onTransactionStarted

        protected abstract void onTransactionStarted()
        This callback represents a new transaction has been initiated after a tap on the POS/Terminal.

        This is for the Mobile Payment Application (MPA) to have state machine on its side when needed OR this is useful for showing the user that a new payment has been initiated.

      • onAuthenticationRequired

        protected abstract void onAuthenticationRequired(@NonNull
                                                 VerificationMethod method)
        Conditional

        This callback triggered to indicate that the payment transaction requires user authentication.

        The application should refer to the method argument to determine what authentication type is required and show according UI.

        Some points to note:

        • This callback may happens after the onTransactionStarted().
        • The application can retrieve the TransactionData by calling getTransactionData(). The transaction data contains detail information (e.g. amount, currency, ...) of this transaction.
        • On the application UI for user authentication, application has to call startAuthenticate(AuthenticationParameter) to proceed the user authentication.
        • Once the authentication is success, the payment transaction will proceed to the next state onReadyToTap().
        Parameters:
        method - The authentication method required for the transaction
        See Also:
        getTransactionData(), startAuthenticate(AuthenticationParameter)

      • onReadyToTap

        protected abstract void onReadyToTap()
        Conditional

        When the user has successfully authenticated, this callback will be triggered.

        Upon receiving this callback, the mobile application should:

        • Display an UI screen to show the remaining time that the authentication is still valid. This is the key validity period configured at D1PayConfigParams.setKeyValidityPeriod(int).
        • Register a timeout callback with registerDeviceAuthTimeoutCallback(DeviceAuthenticationTimeoutCallback) to receive the remaining time for authentication.
        • Ask the end user to tap on the POS/Terminal again before the timer expired.
        • Detail transaction data can be retrieved with getTransactionData().
        See Also:
        D1PayConfigParams.setKeyValidityPeriod(int), registerDeviceAuthTimeoutCallback(DeviceAuthenticationTimeoutCallback), getTransactionData()

      • onTransactionCompleted

        protected abstract void onTransactionCompleted()
        The last callback of a successful transaction.

        It means that the payment data had been sent successfully to the POS/Terminal.

        The detail transaction data can be retrieved with getTransactionData().

        See Also:
        getTransactionData(), deactivate()

      • onError

        protected abstract void onError(@NonNull
                                D1Exception error)
        Any error happens during the payment transaction, this callback will be triggered.

        Some points to note:

        • The mobile application may query the detail transaction data with getTransactionData(). Except for the first callback #onTransactionStarted, after each other stage, if error happens, the detail transaction is available.
        • It is suggested to clean up the transaction with deactivate().
        Parameters:
        error - The detail of the error
        See Also:
        getTransactionData(), deactivate()

      • onNextTransactionReady

        protected void onNextTransactionReady(@NonNull
                                      DeactivationStatus status,
                                      @NonNull
                                      String cardID)
        Callback to notify the readiness of the next payment transaction. This is usually called after the deactivate() has been triggered.
        Parameters:
        status - The status of the deactivation
        cardID - The cardID had been used for this transaction. If the status is DeactivationStatus.Code.FAIL, integrator can make use of this parameter to either:
        • Reset the default payment card.
        • Request replenishment for this card.
        See Also:
        D1PayWallet.setDefaultPaymentDigitalCard(String, D1Task.Callback), D1PayWallet.replenish(String, boolean, DeviceAuthenticationCallback, D1Task.Callback)

      • registerDeviceAuthTimeoutCallback

        public final void registerDeviceAuthTimeoutCallback(@NonNull
                                                    DeviceAuthenticationTimeoutCallback callback)
        Register callback to receive the update of the authentication validity
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to receive the remaining time
        See Also:
        onReadyToTap()

      • startAuthenticate

        public final void startAuthenticate(@NonNull
                                    AuthenticationParameter params)
        Start the user authentication using the input parameters
        Parameters:
        params - The parameter for user authentication
        See Also:
        onAuthenticationRequired(VerificationMethod)

      • deactivate

        public final void deactivate()
        The mobile application is suggested to call this API to deactivate the current transaction at the end of its UI flow (example Activity.onDestroy())

      • getTransactionData

        @Nullable
public final TransactionData getTransactionData()
        Retrieve the detail data of current payment transaction
        Returns:
        The payment transaction data (if available). If any error happens while initialising the transaction, this function will return null.
